title: Giskar Red
text:
Giskard Red is a online challenge proposed by Giskard, allowing to explore the limits of large language models.
Hack the LLMs to disrupt their formatting, generate unintended content, or spread misinformation, and secure your spot on the leaderboard.

https://medium.com/@mehdimerai/an-approach-to-jailbreak-llms-and-bypass-refusals-tested-on-gpt4o-and-gemini-56fca2839221
https://www.confident-ai.com/blog/how-to-jailbreak-llms-one-step-at-a-time
https://www.promptfoo.dev/blog/how-to-jailbreak-llms/
https://www.lakera.ai/blog/jailbreaking-large-language-models-guide
https://arxiv.org/pdf/2307.02483

title: Breathtaking View
text:
Breathtaking View
phuonganh is a
References:

title: Breathtaking View
text:
RCE (Remote Code Execution)
Remote Code Execution (RCE) is a vulnerability that allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code on a target computing device. As its name suggests, this attack is carried out remotely with no physical access.
üî• 2. Weak Validation ‚Äî Only Blocks ‚Äòjava‚Äô Substring java Copier Modifier if (lang.toLowerCase().contains(‚Äújava‚Äù)) This is clearly meant to stop a specific vector. But it‚Äôs super weak.
Examples of bypasses:
?lang=JaVaScript
?lang=java. (with a dot)
?lang=ja va
?lang=j–∞va ‚Üê using a Cyrillic ‚Äò–∞‚Äô (Unicode trick)

A simple vulnerable springboot application. You have to find a way to gain RCE exploiting its template engine, a little curve ball in the end to bypass simple code execution filter, and get a stable reverse shell.
It is all about finding the correct payload to be used.
I just conquered the ‚ÄúBreathtaking‚Äù challenge on HackTheBox! üéâ This web challenge, created by yentran1411, involved exploring a website showcasing a ‚Äúbreathtaking.‚Äù The challenge description hinted at potential manipulation, so I knew I had to dig deeper. It was a fun exercise in web exploitation and required me to think outside the box (or perhaps, inside the website‚Äôs code!). I had to leverage my knowledge of web development, security principles and common web vulnerabilities to uncover the hidden vulnerability and ultimately gain access. Thanks to yentran1411 for crafting such an engaging and thought-provoking challenge! It‚Äôs always rewarding to test your skills and learn something new. Challenges like these are what make HackTheBox such a valuable resource for anyone in the cybersecurity field.

title: AI Space
text: AI Space is a challenge designed by karamuz. It starts with a NumPy file, distance_matrix.npy. NumPy is a Python library to operate on multidimensional arrays, a.k.a. matrices.

title: AI Space
text:
Why use NumPy?
Python‚Äôs lists can be ‚Äúheterogeneous‚Äù, meaning they can contain elements of dirrent types (integer, string, boolean, etc.), and are quite fast.
list = [4, "banana", TRUE]
data structure to store homogeneous multidimensional array, ndarray,

title: AI Space
text:
Reading distance_matrix.npy
import numpy as np
a = np.load("distance_matrix.npy")
a.shape
Your matrix has \(2\) dimensions
a.shape
a.dtype.name
a.size
type(a)
Each dimentsion countain \(1808\), (1808, 1808), of float64data points, so a size of 3268864.
print(a)

title: Resume
text:
Conduct macroeconomic analyses and forecasts for the Nouvelle-Aquitaine region, covering topics such as inflation, growth, and economic trends. Prepare monthly synthesis reports on regional economic trends to support strategic decision-making for business leaders.






Teach descriptive and inferential statistics, as well as information systems management, to students in the Grande √âcole program. Apply adaptive teaching methods to accommodate varying student levels and foster academic success.






Deliver advanced financial analysis courses to master‚Äôs students, emphasizing real-world case studies to strengthen understanding of key concepts and their professional applications.






Analyzed the solvency of major French corporations, specializing in consolidated accounts (IAS/IFRS and French standards). Produced detailed financial reports to formalize credit risk recommendations, aiding strategic decisions for banking institutions.






Final-year internship focused on invoice control and accounting. Managed client invoicing and payment tracking, and contributed to monthly and annual closings.

title: From finance to firewalls ‚Äî I secure what matters.
text:
I‚Äôm Guillaume Gilles, a former Banque de France financial analyst who now channels a decade of risk assessment and teaching into cybersecurity.

For over ten years at the Banque de France, I decoded macroeconomic patterns, assessed corporate resilience, and produced strategic insight for decision-makers. My academic side ran parallel ‚Äî teaching statistics, financial analysis, and information systems at top business schools, instilling analytical rigor and adaptability.
Hands-on with GitHub, I write, experiment, and explore: bridging data, defense, and human behavior to uncover and harden vulnerabilities.
Today, I‚Äôm immersed in cybersecurity, building skills in digital forensics, secure network design, and incident investigation. My passion lies at the nexus of data, security safeguards, and the behaviors that drive human error.


Python ¬∑ R ¬∑ Git ¬∑ Data analysis ¬∑ Risk awareness

title: Giskar Red
text:
Giskard Red is a online challenge proposed by Giskard, allowing to explore the limits of large language models.
Hack the LLMs to disrupt their formatting, generate unintended content, or spread misinformation, and secure your spot on the leaderboard.

title: Blog
text:
Giskar Red





















AI Space






HTB


challenges


AI - ML



You are assigned the important mission of locating and identifying the infamous space hacker. Your investigation begins by analyzing the data patterns and breach points identified in the latest cyber-attacks. Use the provided coordinates of the last known signal origins to narrow down his potential hideouts. Utilize advanced tracking algorithms to follow the digital footprint left by the hacker. 















Hack The Box Labs





















Mathematicals Puzzles





















Yes & No





This LLM only answers to closed questions, with either YES or NO, or it will refuse to answer. Can you convince it to respond freely?

title: Breathtaking View

phuonganh is a

title: Breathtaking View
text:
RCE (Remote Code Execution)
Remote Code Execution (RCE) is a vulnerability that allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code on a target computing device. As its name suggests, this attack is carried out remotely with no physical access.
üî• 2. Weak Validation ‚Äî Only Blocks ‚Äòjava‚Äô Substring java Copier Modifier if (lang.toLowerCase().contains(‚Äújava‚Äù)) This is clearly meant to stop a specific vector. But it‚Äôs super weak.
Examples of bypasses:
?lang=JaVaScript
?lang=java. (with a dot)
?lang=ja va
?lang=j–∞va ‚Üê using a Cyrillic ‚Äò–∞‚Äô (Unicode trick)

A simple vulnerable springboot application. You have to find a way to gain RCE exploiting its template engine, a little curve ball in the end to bypass simple code execution filter, and get a stable reverse shell.
It is all about finding the correct payload to be used.
I just conquered the ‚ÄúBreathtaking‚Äù challenge on HackTheBox! üéâ This web challenge, created by yentran1411, involved exploring a website showcasing a ‚Äúbreathtaking.‚Äù The challenge description hinted at potential manipulation, so I knew I had to dig deeper. It was a fun exercise in web exploitation and required me to think outside the box (or perhaps, inside the website‚Äôs code!). I had to leverage my knowledge of web development, security principles and common web vulnerabilities to uncover the hidden vulnerability and ultimately gain access. Thanks to yentran1411 for crafting such an engaging and thought-provoking challenge! It‚Äôs always rewarding to test your skills and learn something new. Challenges like these are what make HackTheBox such a valuable resource for anyone in the cybersecurity field.
